body_content.explanation: relating to the editor (= the person in charge) or editors of a newspaper, magazine, television programme, etc. and to the power to decide what is published or shown in it:
examples: The newspaper's staff insisted on complete editorial independence from its owners.
Editorial decisions on the show are made by senior news editors.

body_content.explanation: relating to someone who writes, corrects, or changes pieces of text to be published, or their work:
examples: There are more ads on the page than editorial content.
They increased the budget so they could hire more editorial staff.
Many jobs in publishing are marketing jobs rather than editorial.

body_content.explanation: an article in a newspaper that expresses the editor's (= the person in charge of the newspaper's) opinion on a subject of particular interest at the present time:
examples: All the papers deal with the same subject in their editorials.
The Times and The Observer published editorials criticizing the minister.
